document_title: Gynecomastia: Causes, signs, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
To accurately determine the condition of gynecomastia in men, the doctor will first conduct a clinical examination to carefully evaluate the patient's breast tissue, abdomen and genitals. Then, the doctor will prescribe the patient to undergo a number of tests to determine the possible cause of gynecomastia, screen for breast cancer, and rule out conditions that can cause symptoms similar to those of women. gynecomastia (pseudogynecomastia, breast cancer, breast abscess), including:
Blood tests; Mammography (breast X-ray); Computed tomography (CT); Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI); Testicular ultrasound; Tissue biopsy
Blood tests can help diagnose gynecomastia in men
